title: Distributed charge - sphere inside grounded shell

content.question: A charged insulating sphere is surrounded by a concentric, spherical conducting shell that is connected to ground, as shown in the figure. The insulating sphere has a radius of <math alttext="0.10 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> and a symmetric charge density <math alttext="rho of r, equals beta times r cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ρ</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>r</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>β</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is the distance from the sphere’s center and <math alttext="beta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>β</mi></math> is a constant equal to <math alttext="6.0 coulombs per meter to the sixth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>/</mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mn>6</mn></msup></math>. The conducting shell has an inner radius of <math alttext="0.20 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> and an outer radius of <math alttext="0.25 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. What is the charge on the inner surface of the conducting shell?

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
